derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the sense 'buy back'): from Old French redimer or Latin redimere, from re- 'back' + emere 'buy'

entry.tran: 挽回（声誉）；补偿，弥补（过错）
entry.def: If you redeem yourself or your reputation, you do something that makes people have a good opinion of you again after you have behaved or performed badly.

example.ex: He had realized the mistake he had made and wanted to redeem himself...
example.tran: 他已经认识到了自己的错误，想要进行弥补。

example.ex: The sole redeeming feature of your behaviour is that you're not denying it.
example.tran: 你的行为中唯一可取之处就是你没有否认错误。

entry.def: When something redeems an unpleasant thing or situation, it prevents it from being completely bad.

example.ex: Work is the way that people seek to redeem their lives from futility...
example.tran: 工作可以避免人们虚度生命。

example.ex: ...a long face with too prominent features that were redeemed by a fine pair of brown eyes...
example.tran: 脸部较长，五官很突出，还好一双棕色的眼睛长得恰到好处

entry.def: If you redeem a debt or money that you have promised to someone, you pay money that you owe or that you promised to pay.

example.ex: The amount required to redeem the mortgage was £358,587...
example.tran: 需要偿还的抵押贷款总计358,587英镑。

example.ex: Take the voucher to your local branch of Woolworths and it will be redeemed for one toy.
example.tran: 持兑换券到当地沃尔沃斯的分店可以兑换一个玩具。

entry.def: If you redeem an object that belongs to you, you get it back from someone by repaying them money that you borrowed from them, after using the object as a guarantee.

example.ex: Make sure you know exactly what you will be paying back when you plan to redeem the item.
example.tran: 务必弄清楚将来赎回物品时需要支付多少钱。

entry.def: In religions such as Christianity, to redeem someone means to save them by freeing them from sin and evil.

example.ex: ...a new female spiritual force to redeem the world.
example.tran: 全新的拯救世界的女性精神力量

means.word_mean: 2. exchange or buy back for money; under threat
4. convert into cash; of commercial papers

pre预先+em拿+pt→预先拿[即以先买权取得]
red=re回+em拿,获得,拿走后[变空]→拿回→redeem赎回
